item.title: Study: CTE Found In Nearly All Donated NFL Player Brains
item.description: July 25, 2017 - As the country starts to get back into its most popular professional team sport, this serves as a reminder of how dangerous football can be.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - As the country starts to get back into its most popular professional team sport, this serves as a reminder of how dangerous football can be. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/25/539198429/study-cte-found-in-nearly-all-donated-nfl-player-brains

item.title: What Are The Planet's Real 'Talking' Chimps And Gorillas Saying?
item.description: July 25, 2017 - Movies are full of loquacious chimps, but could nonhuman apes really use language? NPR's Skunk Bear sorts through the disturbing history of research on ape language to sort fact from wishful thinking.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 25, 2017 - Movies are full of loquacious chimps, but could nonhuman apes really use language? NPR's Skunk Bear sorts through the disturbing history of research on ape language to sort fact from wishful thinking. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/25/538580495/what-are-the-planet-s-real-talking-chimps-and-gorillas-saying

item.title: Study: Memphis Support Program For New Moms Especially Helps Boys
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Nurse-Family Partnership programs provide low-income mothers with checkups. Robert Siegel speaks with Nobel Laureate James Heckman on the benefits of NFP, which is found to especially help boys.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Nurse-Family Partnership programs provide low-income mothers with checkups. Robert Siegel speaks with Nobel Laureate James Heckman on the benefits of NFP, which is found to especially help boys. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/24/539087970/study-memphis-support-program-for-new-moms-especially-helps-boys

item.title: The Senate Health Care Vote, Simplified
item.description: July 24, 2017 - President Trump is pushing the Senate to repeal and replace Obamacare this week. But with multiple bills in play, it's far from clear what the Senate would vote on. Here's a recap of the options.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - President Trump is pushing the Senate to repeal and replace Obamacare this week. But with multiple bills in play, it's far from clear what the Senate would vote on. Here's a recap of the options. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/24/539051768/the-senate-health-care-vote-simplified

item.title: How Crisis Pregnancy Center Clients Rely On Medicaid
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Medicaid pays for nearly half the births in the U.S., and centers that counsel women against abortion often help pregnant women enroll in Medicaid so they don't have to worry about health care costs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Medicaid pays for nearly half the births in the U.S., and centers that counsel women against abortion often help pregnant women enroll in Medicaid so they don't have to worry about health care costs. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/24/538556088/crisis-pregnancy-centers-help-pregnant-women-enroll-in-medicaid

item.title: Parents Of Terminally Ill British Baby Charlie Gard End Legal Fight
item.description: July 24, 2017 - The couple's lawyer told the London High Court that new medical tests have shown that an experimental treatment would not help at this point, ending their legal fight to transport him to the U.S.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - The couple's lawyer told the London High Court that new medical tests have shown that an experimental treatment would not help at this point, ending their legal fight to transport him to the U.S. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/24/539020732/parents-of-terminally-ill-british-baby-charlie-gard-end-legal-fight

item.title: Female Athletes Are Closing The Gender Gap When It Comes To Concussions
item.description: July 24, 2017 - Gina "Danger" Mazany is a professional mixed martial arts athlete, and she's helping researchers learn more about head injuries and the female brain.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 24, 2017 - Gina "Danger" Mazany is a professional mixed martial arts athlete, and she's helping researchers learn more about head injuries and the female brain. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/24/538294331/female-athletes-are-closing-the-gender-gap-when-it-comes-to-concussions

item.title: Beyond The Nasty Needle: Trying To Make Vaccines More Comfy And Convenient
item.description: July 23, 2017 - From tiny, dissolving needles to high-powered liquid streams and nasal sprays, scientists are developing alternatives to typical vaccinations.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 23, 2017 - From tiny, dissolving needles to high-powered liquid streams and nasal sprays, scientists are developing alternatives to typical vaccinations. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/23/537287781/beyond-the-nasty-needle-trying-to-make-vaccines-more-comfy-and-convenient

item.title: Rural Californians Want Price Relief From GOP Health Bill, But Most Won't Get It
item.description: July 22, 2017 - GOP efforts to repeal the ACA are still in flux, and there's more talk now of trying to work out bipartisan fixes for Obamacare. But most suggested remedies won't fix the problems in remote regions.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 22, 2017 - GOP efforts to repeal the ACA are still in flux, and there's more talk now of trying to work out bipartisan fixes for Obamacare. But most suggested remedies won't fix the problems in remote regions. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/22/538396570/rural-californians-want-price-relief-from-gop-health-bill-but-most-won-t-get-it

item.title: Is Inflammation Bad For You Or Good For You?
item.description: July 21, 2017 - It depends what's causing the inflammation and how long it lasts. But the habits that keep you healthy overall also help prevent the bad inflammation that increases the risk of chronic disease.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 21, 2017 - It depends what's causing the inflammation and how long it lasts. But the habits that keep you healthy overall also help prevent the bad inflammation that increases the risk of chronic disease. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/21/538377221/is-inflammation-bad-for-you-or-good-for-you

item.title: A Wake-Up Call: Coffee Recalled By FDA For Having Viagra-Like Ingredient
item.description: July 21, 2017 - Regulators took issue with the tortuously named "New of Kopi Jantan Tradisional Natural Herbs Coffee," which didn't declare a chemical akin to the erectile dysfunction drug's active ingredient.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 21, 2017 - Regulators took issue with the tortuously named "New of Kopi Jantan Tradisional Natural Herbs Coffee," which didn't declare a chemical akin to the erectile dysfunction drug's active ingredient. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/21/538512368/a-wake-up-call-coffee-recalled-by-fda-for-having-viagra-like-ingredient

item.title: With So Many Obamacare Repeal Options In Play, Confusion Reigns
item.description: July 20, 2017 - Congress has been trying to repeal and/or replace the Affordable Care Act for years. Now it's down to the wire, but there are multiple proposals on the Senate's table, and more could be on the way.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - Congress has been trying to repeal and/or replace the Affordable Care Act for years. Now it's down to the wire, but there are multiple proposals on the Senate's table, and more could be on the way. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/07/20/538360550/with-so-many-obamacare-repeal-options-in-play-confusion-reigns

item.title: Senate Republicans Look Down Uncertain Path On Health Care
item.description: July 20, 2017 - Some Senate Republicans have suggested they will work with Democrats to craft legislation on health care after their party failed repeatedly to pass a bill on their own. But that is also an uncertain path.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - Some Senate Republicans have suggested they will work with Democrats to craft legislation on health care after their party failed repeatedly to pass a bill on their own. But that is also an uncertain path. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/538370615/senate-republicans-look-down-uncertain-path-on-health-care

item.title: GOP Effort To Make Environmental Science 'Transparent' Worries Scientists
item.description: July 20, 2017 - There's a push in Congress to rewrite how science gets used in regulation — and that has researchers worried. The industry-backed bill would let business nitpick raw data and ignore valid results.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - There's a push in Congress to rewrite how science gets used in regulation — and that has researchers worried. The industry-backed bill would let business nitpick raw data and ignore valid results. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/537243392/gop-effort-to-make-environmental-science-transparent-worries-scientists

item.title: Newest Senate Health Care Overhaul Would Increase Uninsured By 22 Million, CBO Says
item.description: July 20, 2017 - The latest report has similar findings to prior estimates: big increases in the uninsured population, with some deficit reduction. But there's a big caveat: This bill will likely change.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 20, 2017 - The latest report has similar findings to prior estimates: big increases in the uninsured population, with some deficit reduction. But there's a big caveat: This bill will likely change. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/20/538343377/newest-senate-health-care-overhaul-to-increase-uninsured-by-22-million-cbo-says
